content.description:
Climbs the right-angling ramp system to finish with the last moves of

Tidbit

(V-easy). This is also the downclimb for the boulder.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Far left side of the South Face and just right of

Tidbit

.

content.description:
Starts from a good edge and then mantels over onto the top. Easier if you go right but you run the risk of tangling with the catclaw.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left edge of the narrow East Face and just left of a Catclaw bush.

content.description: Crank crispy edges to a sloping shelf and finish with a tough mantel on this surprisingly technical problem. Probably about 5.9 or so in difficulty.
content.location:
Left side of the South Face and just right of

Dollop

.

content.description:
Start low from a sloper and then work more slopers until able to press it out. Sort of an eliminate in that you don't grab the arete out right, if you do it will be easier than indicated.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the West Face and just left of the arete.

content.description:
Grab the top, or if short make a move or two on thin flakes, and then mantle the sloping top. Trickier than it looks.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Far right side of the South Face and 10' right of

Snack

behind some bushes.

content.description:
Grab some slopers over the rounded top and press out a standard mantle. Jump off or downclimb off the left side of the South Face.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the West Face.

content.description: Intriquing movement up the faint seam with a nice mantle to finish. The low start is about V0 in difficulty.
content.location:
Right side of the South Face and just right of

Morsel

.

content.description: Climb along the left side of the dark patina patch using good edges to a fun highstep/mantel move to finish. Can be done from a low start at about V0.
